qas.question: Who responds with the employment of capabilities where there is a threat?
What is the definition of CND?

answers.text: CNE, computer network defense (CND), and CNA techniques

qas.question: What is one of the things that Cyberspace defense highly dependent on?
What branch of the military is in charge of Cyberspace defense?

context: This is the passive, active, and dynamic employment of capabilities to respond to imminent or on-going actions against <a0_0><a4_0>Air Force<a4_0/><a0_0/> or Air Force-protected networks, the Air Force's portion of the Global Information Grid, or expeditionary communications assigned to the Air Force. Cyberspace defense incorporates <a2_0>CNE, <a1_0>computer network defense<a1_0/> (CND), and CNA techniques<a2_0/> and may be a contributor to influence operations. It is highly dependent upon ISR, <a3_0>fused all-source intelligence<a3_0/>, automated indications and warning, sophisticated attribution/characterization, situational awareness, assessment, and responsive C2.
